newsitem.title: UK: London coffee futures hit $2,500/tonne, up 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: London coffee futures hit $2,500/tonne, up 10 pct.

text.p: London robusta coffee futures soared 10 percent in just a few minutes on Wednesday to hit $2,500 per tonne, the highest since September 1995.

By 0856 GMT, the benchmark second-month July contract stood at $2,550, up $292, extending a rally in world coffee that has been led by New York on concerns about tight stocks, thin supply and cold weather in Brazil, the biggest exporter.

Robusta coffee futures have now more than doubled since the beginning of the year. The New York futures for the better quality arabica beans from the Americas have risen 150 percent to the highest in 20 years.
"This market is like a freight train. Don't get in front of it," said Victor Henriquez of Miami-based Hencorp-Bestone as New York soared to $2.97 per pound on Wednesday.
With world coffee stocks at a 20-year low, the spectacular rally has triggered several rounds of retail price increases by roasters, the latest being Nestle UK.
